Name: HMS Berkeley
Namesake: A fox hunt in Gloucestershire, England
Badge: On a Field Gold. Upon a Red roundel, in front of two hunting horns in saltire gold and a cross patee white.
Propulsion:
Two x Admiralty 3 drum boilers
Two shaft Parsons geared turbines
19,000 shp (14,000 kW)
Range: 3,500 nmi (6,480 km) at 15 knots (28 km/h) / 1,000 nmi (2,000 km) at 26 knots (48 km/h)
Armament:
4 × QF 4-inch (102 mm) Mark XVI guns on twin mounts Mk. XIX
4 × QF 2-pounder (40 mm) Mk. VIII guns on quad mount MK.VII
2 × 20 mm Oerlikons on single mounts P Mk. III
40 depth charges, 2 throwers, 1 rack
